This should be fixed in GA already. Please recheck after our GA release passed.
@ascrutae Need test on this.

@peng-yongsheng 

# Issue
1. No downstream data, including hour/day/month
2. `TopologyQueryEsDAO#load` can't get any data from `service_relation_server/client_side` index.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5441976/46189116-a128ac80-c31f-11e8-84e3-c97f51ca4910.png)
3. `numOfService`, `numOfEndpoint` query(s) use time range as condition, but in analysis side, there is no cores to update that. For more, read (4)
4. Hearbeat, Ping(new) uplink protocols have not processed, so, I assume this is the root cause of (3)

emm. i am fixed it that  i am resend an  new PR  in testcase repo
The automated test is running. Just wait a moment.

Tag for different System.
And where can I find agent.namespace info in web-ui? thx.
Namespace is for system isolation. Multiple business clusters wouldn't be supported in one skywalking backend and ui cluster.

This file is for release source file. It is ok to use related links.
Please remove the quick start file.
Also, send a pr to fix the readme in 5.x branch too. That branch links codes matching 5.x releases.

I download the Skywalking released package from the http://skywalking.apache.org/downloads , the release package not have docs folder , if we change the link with relative path, they will be unreachable

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8205994/46257921-d63a2800-c4f4-11e8-8de8-a0073d0036d4.png)
Download source release tar. They are there.

I mean that users will encounter this problem when they download the binary package (not source code tar ) and follow the README instructions.  

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8205994/46258069-21edd100-c4f7-11e8-8fd4-a89c61fac8c9.png)


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8205994/46258016-704ea000-c4f6-11e8-9089-2629a40922ff.png)

Most people there are won't download the source code packages
Too many sources, which metrics should to aggregate and show on the UI is the first task.
@kkroy-zs is a frontend developer, he also can devlope our UI. And he is a java developer.
We definitely welcome all kinds of contributions. Consider priority and workloads. Let's make this work step by step.
I see, then, still use absolute path, just change to different paths in different branches, OK?
Because you mentioned, I will close the release vote because this break.
Hope you can fix this soon.
@wu-sheng I hava modified the PR according to the review and submitted a new PR of 5.x branch.

> We definitely welcome all kinds of contributions. Consider priority and workloads. Let's make this work step by step.

As my data structure listed, there are so many data can be gathered. Which one is important to Sky-walking? This is the first step to be considered things, I think. Some index of the data in the list, after all,  only affect the performance of the front-end. As you said, the work should be done step by step.

Now, I'm a front-end engineer, and I also worked at back-end. I think I can hold this front-end's things. And, I have been creating the project for this idea.

supplement:
the requset is send to TokenControllerV2, whicd extends TokenController . it has a  annotation @RequestMapping(value = "oauth/v2.0").
it work if my url  is localhost:8080/cmtoken/oauth/**v1.0**/login.
Why close?

sorry,I  want to contribute other plugins. At the time, I didn't consider using other branches, I used the 5.x branch directly, so I plan to delete the my repo, re-fork once, don't worry, I will resubmit the rabbitmq PR, when i  am writing rabbitmq plugin,and then i also write other  plugins.
Automated testing made me a little dizzy, and it was time consuming, which I didn't consider.
I understand the tests are a little difficult, but that is the way we guarantee our codes quality. Sorry for making you feel not good.

en. automated testing  just some details, it is transparent to me. I can't debug how these things run. So it led to some details of the problem, changed and changed, and then wasted time.
Thank you very much for your open source skywalking, which allowed me to learn a lot about distributed tracking.
Is this a pr? Or just something you are doing?
its a pr...

3ks

You should set your setting in correct markdown format. Your issue is very hard to understand.

The requirements are
- Add settings in es we suggested
- Make sure ES binding right. You set 127.0.01, is your es at local?
- Make sure you connect TCP port of es.

Thanks, I hope now its more readable.

- I added the ES as recommended in the documentation.
- I run ES on my local computer using docker listening to ports 9300 and 9200
- I run skywalking on my local computer as well
